thread.title: New Zealand launches new luxury lodges and charter boat
thread.title_full: New Zealand launches new luxury lodges and charter boat

author: mich@girlracer.me.uk (Michelle Chenery)
title: New Zealand launches new luxury lodges and charter boat
text:
New Zealand launches new luxury lodges and charter boat New Zealand launches new luxury lodges and charter boat Details Category: Venues & Events   13:45 Set in over 600 acres on the shores of Lake Taupo, The Kinloch Club is expanding with The Kinloch Club Villas complementing a spectacular, on-site 18-hole Jack Nicklaus Signature Golf Course. Created by the much-awarded Treetops Lodge and Estate, The Kinloch Club Villas feature a selection of 26 one-bedroom apartments and luxurious two or three-bedroom villas in an exclusive, landscaped setting on the shores of Lake Taupo, the iconic heart-shaped lake at the scenic hub of New Zealand's North Island. 
Inspired to harmonise with the lakeside links course, the villas were designed by Andrew Patterson, perhaps New Zealand's best internationally known and published architect. Interiors are by acclaimed New Zealand lodge designer Virginia Fisher and feature her signature expansive spaces, huge log fireplaces, vista windows, designer details, furnished terraces and sensational marble bathrooms. Villas include beautiful kitchens and in the Club Lodge there are also world-class restaurant and entertainment facilities. Complementing the golf course is a spa with infinity pool, a gym and tennis courts. The Kinloch Club Villas are the perfect base to discover the incredible scenic diversity of New Zealand, from water sports on the lake to winter skiing in Tongariro Park or walking the world-famed Tongariro Crossing. There1s seasonal fly-fishing in some of the world's best trout streams - even adventurous wild game hunting. Gentle sightseeing includes the geysers and bubbling mud of Rotorua, heritage heartland of Maoridom. Helena Bay - new luxury lodge on the Tutukaka Coast – launching January 2016 New Zealand will add another luxury lodge to its collection with the launch of Helena Bay on the Tutukaka Coast, North Island in 2016. The new lodge is just 40-km north of Whangarei or guests can splurge with just a 45-minute helicopter ride from Auckland. Set on 800 acres, Helena Bay will include two and three bedroom villas, all overlooking three kilometres of pristine coastline. The main lodge will house a Turkish Hammam, plunge pool, gym, sauna, luxury spa, a 25-metre heated pool, a library, three lounge areas, a restaurant, an outdoor fire pit and three private beaches for guests' exclusive use. The Landing Residences – to launch new charter boat to vineyard villa The Landing Residences, luxury accommodation on the Purerua peninsula and just a 40-minute drive from Kerikeri, will launch a new charter boat, Atarangi, in 2016. Sleeping six in three double rooms, the new boat will be available for charter in the Bay of Islands and Auckland. The boat will also be available for day trips for up to 18 guests. The Landing Residence will also see the launch of the new Vineyard Villa. Set amongst the vines, the villa will consist of three-bedrooms and will be the fourth residence on the property. Dive Lodge – new luxury retreat in Tutukaka – launching 2016 Due to open early 2016, Dive Tutukaka will launch a new resort styled retreat, Dive Lodge. The lodge will include six large boutique rooms as well as a house bar, lounge, sauna and pool area. A new live-abroad styled vessel will also be available to guests and the lodge can arrange three and five night trips travelling to the Poor Knights Island and Northland’s shipwrecks.
